info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, BULLOCH AND EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 243 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Eden to near Groveland, and moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph, up to penny sized hail and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Springfield, Pembroke, Lanier, Guyton, Daisy, Marlow, Eden and Groveland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 15 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
